column12: Multi Stage - multiple fractures, fault planes, infilling, altering event. Contains overprinting fracturing or overprinting selvedge.

column2: Line - Intersection axis of 2 planes Sm,  Sn
column12: Single Stage - single fracturing, infilling, altering event. Simple geometry +/- layering with growth bands and Zoned.
Massive - unifom texture with no discrete fractures
Matching Walls/Parallel - vein walls match across void/infill
Vuggy - visible voids often with crystal infill on margins
Wallrock Screens - narrow slivers of wall rock broken parallel to vein and remain insitu
Zoned - spatial zoning of mineral assemblages, describing infill or selvedge
Shear Veins - formed by fracturing and faulting along vein walls
Tension Veins - formed by extension normal to vein walls
Tightly healed, hard non-softening impermeable filling eg quartz
Unaltered joint walls, surface staining only eg chlorite, <5mm carbonate or rock
Slightly altered joint walls, clay or chlorite veneer, 5-10mm carbonate or rock
Soft clay or mineral coatings 1-2mm, carbonate or crushed rock >10mm
Soft clay or mineral coatings >2mm, carbonate or crushed rock >25mm
BRECCIA ZONE - broken rock with defined boundaries
FOLIATED ZONE - generally narrow, tabular (shear zone)
FRACTURE ZONE - sheeted parallel fractures, tabular, narrow (fault zone)
GOUGE - Broken rock with soft matrix (clays) defined by finer abraded wallrock.
PLANE /SINGLE - movement along a single surface with slickenslides or fibres
